授業目的: The objective of the course is to enhance students’ knowledge of Canada by highlighting historical state of affair which have resulted in the development of a multi-cultural society, economic and political systems, international relations, and its place in the world.  The course also exposes students to Canadian popular culture, history, politics, economic realities, architecture, and languages.
到達目標:
By the end of the semester student should be able to:

Acquire general knowledge of Canada and improve your understanding how Canada has changed over the years.
Identify and discuss Canada’s main political, economic, social, and cultural features that have shaped its past and current realities.
Compare and contrast the differences between the Canadian Cultural Mosaic and the American Melting Pot.
Describe federalism and the three levels of government to explain the rights and responsibilities of citizenship.
授業方法:
You must follow the class syllabus – it provides outlines of the materials covered in each class and provides additional resources that will help you understand issues arising in the class.

Class time is organized to follow, as closely as possible, the syllabus to address different aspects of Canadian political and economic structures. This will follow with questions and answers to deepen students’ understanding of the materials discussed at the start of every class. Students should reflect on the class discussions to relate course issues to the “real world” of Canadian society and communicate with the instructor for further guidance.
